summary.long: Galatians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle (not from men nor through man, but through Jesus Christ and God the Father, who raised Him from the dead),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and all the brothers who are with me,
To the churches of Galatia:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who gave Himself for our sins, that He might deliver us from this present evil age, according to the will of our God and Father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom be glory forever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I marvel that you are turning away so soon from Him who called you in the grace of Christ to a different gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which is not a gospel. But there are some who trouble you and would pervert the gospel of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although if we or an angel from heaven preach any other gospel to you than the one we have preached to you, let him be accursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As we said before, so I say now again: If anyone preaches any other gospel to you than the one you have received, let him be accursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For am I now seeking the approval of men or of God? Or am I trying to please men? For if I were still trying to please men, I would not be the servant of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I reveal to you, brothers, that the gospel which was preached by me is not according to man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I neither received it from man, neither was I taught it, except by a revelation of Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have heard of my former life in Judaism, how I persecuted the church of God beyond measure and tried to destroy it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and progressed in Judaism above many of my equals in my own heritage, being more exceedingly zealous for the traditions of my fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when it pleased God, who set me apart since I was in my mother’s womb and called me by His grace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to reveal His Son in me, that I might preach Him among the nations, I did not immediately confer with flesh and blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were apostles before me. But I went into Arabia, and returned again to Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter and stayed with him for fifteen days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw none of the other apostles except James, the Lord’s brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In what I am writing to you, before God, I do not lie!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I went into the regions of Syria and Cilicia
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and was unknown by face to the churches of Judea which were in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had heard only, “He who persecuted us in times past now preaches the faith which he once destroyed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they glorified God because of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas and also took Titus with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I went up in response to a revelation and communicated to them the gospel which I preach among the Gentiles. But privately I communicated to those who were of reputation, in case I might be running, or had run, in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even Titus, who was with me, though he was a Greek, was not compelled to be circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened because false brothers were secretly brought in, who sneaked in to spy out our liberty, which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We did not yield to subjection to them, not for an hour, that the truth of the gospel might continue with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But of these who seemed to be something—whatever they were, it makes no difference to me; God shows no partiality to anyone—for those who seemed to be something added nothing to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the contrary, they saw that I was entrusted with the gospel to the uncircumcised, as the gospel to the circumcised was to Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He who worked effectively in Peter for the apostleship to the circumcised worked effectively in me toward the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When James, Cephas, and John, who seemed to be pillars, understood the grace that was given to me, they gave to Barnabas and me the right hand of fellowship, that we should go to the Gentiles and they to the circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only they requested that we should remember the poor, which I also was eager to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Peter came to Antioch, I withstood him face to face, because he stood condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before certain men came from James, he ate with the Gentiles. But when they came, he withdrew and separated himself, fearing those who were of the circumcision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the other Jews, likewise, joined together in hypocrisy with him, so that even Barnabas was carried away by their hypocrisy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when I saw that they were not straightforward about the truth of the gospel, I said to Peter before them all, “If you, being a Jew, live like a Gentile and not like a Jew, why do you compel the Gentiles to live like Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are Jews by nature, and not Gentile sinners,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet we know that a man is not justified by the works of the law, but through faith in Jesus Christ. Even we have believed in Christ Jesus, so that we might be justified by faith in Christ, rather than by the works of the law. For by the works of the law no flesh shall be justified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If, while we seek to be justified by Christ, we ourselves also are found to be sinners, is Christ therefore the minister of sin? God forbid!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I build again the things which I destroyed, I make myself a transgressor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For through the law I am dead to the law, that I might live for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have been crucified with Christ. It is no longer I who live, but Christ who lives in me. And the life I now live in the flesh, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave Himself for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not nullify the grace of God. For if righteousness comes by the law, then Christ died in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O foolish Galatians! Who has bewitched you that you should not obey the truth? Before your eyes Jesus Christ was clearly portrayed among you as crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I want to learn only this from you: Did you receive the Spirit through the works of the law, or by hearing with faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are you so foolish? Having begun in the Spirit, are you now being perfected by the flesh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have you endured so many things for nothing, if indeed it was for nothing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does God give you the Spirit and work miracles among you by the works of the law, or by hearing with faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even Abraham “believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore know that those who are of faith are the sons of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the Gentiles by faith, preached the gospel in advance to Abraham, saying, “In you shall all the nations be blessed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then those who are of faith are blessed with faithful Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all who rely on the works of the law are under the curse. For it is written, “Cursed is everyone who does not continue in all things which are written in the Book of the Law, to do them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it is evident that no man is justified by the law in the sight of God, for “The just shall live by faith.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the law is not of faith, for “The man who does them shall live by them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christ has redeemed us from the curse of the law by being made a curse for us—as it is written, “Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Jesus Christ, that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, I am speaking in human terms: Though it is only a man’s covenant, yet if it is ratified, no one annuls or adds to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the promises were made to Abraham and his Seed. He does not say, “and to seeds,” meaning many, but “and to your Seed,” meaning one, who is Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this I say, that the law, which came four hundred and thirty years later, does not annul the covenant that was ratified by God in Christ, so as to nullify the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the inheritance comes from the law, it no longer comes from the promise. But God gave it to Abraham through a promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What purpose then does the law serve? It was added because of transgressions, until the Seed should come to whom the promise was made. And it was ordained through angels by the hand of a mediator.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a mediator is not a mediator for only one party, but God is one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is the law then contrary to the promises of God? God forbid! For if there had been a law given which could have given life, righteousness would indeed come through the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Scripture has confined all things under sin, that the promise through faith in Jesus Christ might be given to those who believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But before faith came, we were imprisoned under the law, kept for the faith which was later to be revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the law was our tutor to bring us to Christ, that we might be justified by faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now that faith has come, we are no longer under a tutor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are all sons of God by faith in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as many of you as have been baptized into Christ have put on Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither slave nor free, and there is neither male nor female, for you are all one in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you are Christ’s, then you are Abraham’s seed, and heirs according to the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I say that as long as the heir is a child, he does not differ from a servant though he is lord of all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he is under tutors and governors until the time appointed by the father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when we were children, we were in bondage to the elements of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the fullness of time came, God sent forth His Son, born from a woman, born under the law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to redeem those who were under the law, that we might receive the adoption as sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because you are sons, God has sent forth into our hearts the Spirit of His Son, crying, “Abba, Father!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you are no longer a servant, but a son, and if a son, then an heir of God through Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Previously, when you did not know God, you served those who by nature are not gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now, after you have known God, or rather are known by God, how do you turn again to the weak and beggarly elemental forces to which you desire again to be in bondage?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You observe days and months and seasons and years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am afraid for you, lest I have worked for you in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, I ask you, become as I am, for I also have become as you are. You have done me no wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know that it was because of an infirmity of the flesh that I first preached the gospel to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though my infirmity was a trial to you, you neither despised nor rejected me, but received me as an angel of God, even as Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So where is your blessing? For I bear witness of you that, if it had been possible, you would have plucked out your own eyes and given them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have I therefore become your enemy because I tell you the truth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They would zealously influence you, but not favorably. Yes, they would exclusively control you, so that you might consult them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is good to be zealous in a good manner always and not only when I am present with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My little children, of whom I labor in birth again until Christ is formed in you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I desire to be present with you now and to change my tone, for I am displeased with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell me, you who desire to be under the law, do you not hear the law?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written that Abraham had two sons, the one by a slave woman, the other by a free woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who was of the slave woman was born according to the flesh, but he of the free woman through the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things are an allegory, for these are the two covenants. The one is from Mount Sinai, which gives birth to bondage; she is Hagar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia, and represents the present Jerusalem, and is in bondage with her children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jerusalem which is above is free, which is our mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is written:
“Rejoice, barren woman
    who does not bear;
break forth and shout,
    you who have no labor pains!
For the desolate has many more children
    than she who has a husband.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we, brothers, like Isaac, are the children of promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as it was then, he who was born after the flesh persecuted him who was born after the Spirit, so it is now also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless what does the Scripture say? “Cast out the slave woman and her son, for the son of the slave woman shall not be heir with the son of the free woman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, brothers, we are not children of the slave woman, but of the free woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For freedom Christ freed us. Stand fast therefore and do not be entangled again with the yoke of bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed I, Paul, say to you that if you become circumcised, Christ will profit you nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I testify again to every man who is circumcised that he is obligated to keep the whole law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have been cut off from Christ, whoever of you are justified by law; you have fallen from grace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we, through the Spirit, by faith, eagerly wait for the hope of righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision means anything, but faith which works through love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You were running well. Who hindered you from obeying the truth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This persuasion does not come from Him who calls you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A little yeast leavens the whole batch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have confidence in you through the Lord that you will not think otherwise. But he who is troubling you shall bear his judgment, whoever he is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, if I am still preaching circumcision, why do I still suffer persecution? Then the offense of the cross has ceased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wish that those who are troubling you would castrate themselves!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, brothers, have been called to liberty. Only do not use liberty to give an opportunity to the flesh, but by love serve one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the entire law is fulfilled in one word, even in this: “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you bite and devour one another, take heed that you are not consumed by one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say then, walk in the Spirit, and you shall not fulfill the lust of the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the flesh lusts against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh. These are in opposition to one another, so that you may not do the things that you please.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the works of the flesh are revealed, which are these: adultery, sexual immorality, impurity, lewdness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: idolatry, sorcery, hatred, strife, jealousy, rage, selfishness, dissensions, heresies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: envy, murders, drunkenness, carousing, and the like. I warn you, as I previously warned you, that those who do such things shall not inherit the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, gentleness, goodness, faith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: meekness, and self-control; against such there is no law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who are Christ’s have crucified the flesh with its passions and lusts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us not be conceited, provoking one another and envying one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, if a man is caught in any transgression, you who are spiritual should restore such a one in the spirit of meekness, watching yourselves, lest you also be tempted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bear one another’s burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if someone thinks himself to be something when he is nothing, he deceives himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But let each one examine his own work, and then he will have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For each one shall bear his own burden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him who is taught in the word share all good things with him who teaches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be not deceived. God is not mocked. For whatever a man sows, that will he also reap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the one who sows to his own flesh will from the flesh reap corruption, but the one who sows to the Spirit will from the Spirit reap eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let us not grow weary in doing good, for in due season we shall reap, if we do not give up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, as we have opportunity, let us do good to all people, especially to those who are of the household of faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You see what large letters I have written to you with my own hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is those who desire to make a good showing in the flesh that try to compel you to be circumcised, only that they may not be persecuted for the cross of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they themselves who are circumcised do not keep the law. But they desire to have you circumcised, so that they may boast in your flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God forbid that I should boast, except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom the world is crucified to me, and I to the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision means anything, but a new creation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peace and mercy be on all who walk according to this rule and upon the Israel of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From now on let no one trouble me, for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
